results.title: That's one of my talents
results.brief_description: This program aims to provide school leavers with information about a range of non-traditional occupations and working styles. It shows specific examples of both “alternative” money-generating activities and life style options currently being undertaken by Victorians.

results.title: Thanksgiving
results.brief_description: An animated story about a chicken, ready for roasting, climbs down the stairs, escapes through a cat door, only to meet an unexpected final end. No spoken commentary.

results.title: Thamesmead '68
results.brief_description: Thamesmead is a new community being developed on the site of the Royal Arsenal by the London Borough Councils of Greenwich and Bexley, co-operating with government departments, private developers and representatives of many organisations. Its 17,000 homes will provide a new community for 60,000 Londoners. Shows the thinking and planning that has gone into Thamesmead.

results.title: Texture in painting
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the significance of texture in painting and in everyday life. Painters Phoebe Flory and Eliot O’Hara explain the thinking behind the use of textures, with illustrative examples that span the history of art from the Ming Dynasty to today’s non-objective painters.

results.title: Text rain
results.brief_description: TEXT RAIN is a playful interactive installation that blurs the boundary between the familiar and the magical. Participants in TEXT RAIN installation use familiar instruments of their bodies, to do what seems magical - to lift and play with falling letters that do not really exist. In the TEXT RAIN installation participants stand or move in front of a large projection screen. On the screen they see a mirrored video projection of themselves in black and white, combined with colour animation of falling text. Like rain or snow, the text appears to land on the participants heads and arms. The text responds to the participants mentions and can be caught, lifted, and then let fall again. The falling text will land on anything darker than a certain threshold, and fall whenever that obstacle is removed.

results.title: Testing multiple handicapped children
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to evaluate the potential abilities of pre-school children with single and multiple handicaps, by testing three children of varying disabilities and backgrounds: Kevin is unable to move without help, Millie cannot speak and is mentally retarded, and Jimmie has poor hearing and sight, and is suspected of mental retardation

results.title: Testing infants (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
Aims to give a general picture of the development of infant abilities during the first eighteen months of life and to show how an experienced tester manages the test situation. Shows Dr. Aidan MacFarlane, a paediatrician, assessing the cognitive development of a number of infants aged from 3 to 19 months

results.title: Ways of studying children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Cuthbertson, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
Theories of child development go through phases with research leading to the formulation of new theories. The work of three psychologists is examined: first research on mother/child interaction, secondly styles of tutoring for pre-school children, and thirdly babies perception of containment.

group_siblings.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)

results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.
